description: A detailed diagram illustrating the light-dependent reactions. It should show a chloroplast with thylakoid membranes, light hitting chlorophyll, water splitting, oxygen being released, and the formation of ATP and NADPH.
A flowchart illustrating the Calvin Cycle. It should show CO2 entering, ATP and NADPH being used, glucose being produced, and the regeneration of RuBP.

A 2D line graph showing the relationship between light intensity (X-axis) and the rate of photosynthesis (Y-axis). The X-axis should be labeled "Light Intensity (arbitrary units)" and the Y-axis "Rate of Photosynthesis (arbitrary units)". The curve should start at the origin, increase linearly at first, then gradually level off into a plateau, indicating that at higher light intensities, another factor (like CO2 concentration or temperature) becomes limiting.
